Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "package provides  in nuspec/neget pkgs. " (#7217) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
while this is a nicety for chocolatey ...  which consumes nuget... 
I could see Other uses..  ie MSI/msix , install , Nuget to dynamically update sub packages. 

package Say Anaconda , (https://www.anaconda.com/distribution/) 

_insted of depends_ , **Package provides** Depend Python 3.7 , 
provides xyz , 
 and can document all the bundled in depends.. it will install. 

**package C**: now wants python,  _anaconda checks off the box , as python is installed by_ Anaconda..  while useful for chocolatey/nuget  for sure , i'm sure other bundlers could use to make self updating MSI , ie update registry of etc.. , so even if needing repair , the new map file will now use nuget to verify updates have not corrupted etc. 

APP B needs =or less than <  5.2 can add to its folders.. else , can reduce adding more deps ...
via a larger MSI bundle.  , however making an added install of pkg dep to an app folder if required else will just use the depends provided by a bundler or things.. ie Anaconda , has over 100 pkgs included... 

Linux also has known Package Provides DEP A, B or C buddled in.. , also keeps it managed as to not clobber deps the main package provided and or handles upgrades  cleanly .. ie ELK services, needs Kibinana > or = to X but not lower than W.... 


any rate , I'm not sure were to put a feature suggestions.. but 

adding a provides these depends field could be of use..

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "'--locked-mode' restore flag not respected if lock file is empty or malformed" (#8160) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): dotnet.exe

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate): 2.2.105

## Automated repro
You can download [lockedModeNotRespectedRepro.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/3218983/lockedModeNotRespectedRepro.zip) and run repro.bat for an automated repro.

## Detailed manual repro steps

1. Create an empty or invalid packages.lock.json file next to a .csproj

2. Run `dotnet restore --use-lock-file --locked-mode`

**Expected**
The process should fail with an error saying the lock file is incorrect. It should not update the lock file since --locked-mode was set.

**Actual**
The process updates the file. It also returns a 0 exit code

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Add automation for inserting into toolset and special logic for arcade driven branches of the CLI repo" (#8181) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "Add daily "outerloop" integration tests" (#8180) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Consider adding tests that uploads and then restores a package using nuget.org. These tests should run once a day on a reasonable amount of platforms (like Windows/macOS/Linux). The test should cover nuget clients with long term support as well as the latest build. 

This was opened as a follow-up to the incident in which the service index's updated "repository signature" resource caused restore failures in dotnet CLI. See [this OneNote](https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/NuGet/_layouts/OneNote.aspx?id=%2Fteams%2FNuGet%2FTeam%2FNugetServer%2FNugetServerTeamNote&wd=target%28Specs%20%28done%5C%29.one%7CC5206D65-D3F6-4F5B-BBD9-6D00C711BD70%2FNuGet.org%20deployment%20breaks%20restores%20on%20.NET%20Core%20and%7C9214EC73-3600-478D-A8DB-0BB7E1F3A76B%2F%29onenote:https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/NuGet/Team/NugetServer/NugetServerTeamNote/Specs%20(done).one#NuGet.org%20deployment%20breaks%20restores%20on%20.NET%20Core%20and&section-id={C5206D65-D3F6-4F5B-BBD9-6D00C711BD70}&page-id={9214EC73-3600-478D-A8DB-0BB7E1F3A76B}&end)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Distinguish Mono in client user agent" (#8179) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
We cannot know from server telemetry today whether nuget.exe is running under Mono. The client could modify it's user agent for HTTP requests when on the Mono platform.

This was opened as a follow-up to the incident in which the service index's updated "repository signature" resource caused restore failures in dotnet CLI. See [this OneNote](https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/NuGet/_layouts/OneNote.aspx?id=%2Fteams%2FNuGet%2FTeam%2FNugetServer%2FNugetServerTeamNote&wd=target%28Specs%20%28done%5C%29.one%7CC5206D65-D3F6-4F5B-BBD9-6D00C711BD70%2FNuGet.org%20deployment%20breaks%20restores%20on%20.NET%20Core%20and%7C9214EC73-3600-478D-A8DB-0BB7E1F3A76B%2F%29onenote:https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/NuGet/Team/NugetServer/NugetServerTeamNote/Specs%20(done).one#NuGet.org%20deployment%20breaks%20restores%20on%20.NET%20Core%20and&section-id={C5206D65-D3F6-4F5B-BBD9-6D00C711BD70}&page-id={9214EC73-3600-478D-A8DB-0BB7E1F3A76B}&end)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Signing:  attempting to install a tampered signed package performs multiple failed installs (with duplicate output)" (#8175) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
**Repro steps**
1.  Create a signed package.
2.  Tamper the signed package by adding/removing/modifying a file in the package, but leave .signature.p7s intact.
3.  Create a project with a ProjectReference to the signed package.
4.  Restore the project with a package source that contains the tampered package.

**Results**
Install for the tampered package is attempted multiple times and all the output, warnings, and errors are repeated for each install.

**Example**
```
C:\repro>NuGet.exe restore C:\repro\project.csproj -Source C:\repro\source --debug
MSBuild auto-detection: using msbuild version '16.200.19.26402' from 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\Preview\MSBuild\Current\bin'.
Restoring packages for C:\repro\project.csproj...
Installing X 9.0.0.
Package 'X 9.0.0' from source 'C:\repro\source': Signature Hash Algorithm: SHA256
NU3008: Package 'X 9.0.0' from source 'C:\repro\source': The package integrity check failed.
WARNING: NU3027: Package 'X 9.0.0' from source 'C:\repro\source': The signature should be timestamped to enable long-term signature validity after the certificate has expired.
Package 'X 9.0.0' from source 'C:\repro\source': Signature type: Author
Package 'X 9.0.0' from source 'C:\repro\source': Verifying the author primary signature with certificate:
  Subject Name: CN=NuGetTest-7bce06de-c693-441f-bed3-a6527d0ff019
  SHA1 hash: FE1EDCB45B98AE9977663D88C5CCEEE11E58FF4D
  SHA256 hash: 8C45915D4D809DD86034DD9A53F0CED1669853C5299663AB3290CE4AACF91B9D
  Issued by: CN=NuGetTest-7bce06de-c693-441f-bed3-a6527d0ff019
  Valid from: 5/31/2019 10:36:08 AM to 5/31/2019 11:36:08 AM

WARNING: NU3037: Package 'X 9.0.0' from source 'C:\repro\source': The author primary signature validity period has expired.
Installing X 9.0.0.
Package 'X 9.0.0' from source 'C:\repro\source': Signature Hash Algorithm: SHA256
NU3008: Package 'X 9.0.0' from source 'C:\repro\source': The package integrity check failed.
WARNING: NU3027: Package 'X 9.0.0' from source 'C:\repro\source': The signature should be timestamped to enable long-term signature validity after the certificate has expired.
Package 'X 9.0.0' from source 'C:\repro\source': Signature type: Author
Package 'X 9.0.0' from source 'C:\repro\source': Verifying the author primary signature with certificate:
  Subject Name: CN=NuGetTest-7bce06de-c693-441f-bed3-a6527d0ff019
  SHA1 hash: FE1EDCB45B98AE9977663D88C5CCEEE11E58FF4D
  SHA256 hash: 8C45915D4D809DD86034DD9A53F0CED1669853C5299663AB3290CE4AACF91B9D
  Issued by: CN=NuGetTest-7bce06de-c693-441f-bed3-a6527d0ff019
  Valid from: 5/31/2019 10:36:08 AM to 5/31/2019 11:36:08 AM

WARNING: NU3037: Package 'X 9.0.0' from source 'C:\repro\source': The author primary signature validity period has expired.
Committing restore...
Generating MSBuild file C:\repro\obj\project.csproj.nuget.g.props.
Writing assets file to disk. Path: C:\repro\obj\project.assets.json
Restore failed in 10.94 min for C:\repro\project.csproj.

Errors in C:\repro\project.csproj
    NU3008: Package 'X 9.0.0' from source 'C:\repro\source': The package integrity check failed.
    NU3008: Package 'X 9.0.0' from source 'C:\repro\source': The package integrity check failed.

NuGet Config files used:
    C:\repro\NuGet.Config
    C:\Users\dtivel\AppData\Roaming\NuGet\NuGet.Config
    C:\Program Files (x86)\NuGet\Config\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Offline.config

Feeds used:
    C:\repro\source

Installed:
    1 package(s) to C:\repro\project.csproj
```
**Notes**

* Test `Restore_TamperedPackage_FailsAsync` started failing recently [here](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/9cf6165b166a5e26fca15edfb176b61d9fabcb6e/test/NuGet.Clients.FuncTests/NuGet.CommandLine.FuncTest/Commands/RestoreCommandSignPackagesTests.cs#L142) for this reason. 
* The output reports 1 package installed, which also seems incorrect.

 WebNETApp -> Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc 2.2.0 -> Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ViewFeatures 2.2.0 -> Microsoft.AspNetCore.Antiforgery (>= 2.2.0)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Framework parsing should report the string it was trying to parse. " (#8174) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "nuget does not support passing properties during restore" (#8161) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,

we need this in our projects
```
    <TargetFrameworks>net472</TargetFrameworks>
    <TargetFrameworks Condition="'$(EnableDotNetStandard2)' == 'true'">net472;netstandard2.0</TargetFrameworks>
```

the reason is that i want to start using .netstandard and cant ask everyone to install tooling in their machines. so for now im only doing this in build farm and have regression builds there only. Later once everything is sorted out net472 is removed and netstandard will be the only one used.

Problem is that during restore i cant pass msbuild properties to nuget . and nuget restores only for net472 and later the compilation fails. 

can you support this?  i know i can patch the file before hand, but then i need to remenber all files i need to patch and they can be hundreds of project files in need of patching

thanks

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "nuget list & add commands are being deprecated in 5.0" (#34) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
Tracking Issue(s):
* Deprecate ambiguous nuget.exe commands in 5.0 [#7753](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/7753)
  * Deprecate nuget.exe add command [#7923](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/7923)
  * Rename nuget.exe list to nuget.exe search [#7912](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/7912)

The following commands are being deprecated because these are cause of confusion due to their nomenclature and/or other related commands that already exist:
* [`nuget list`](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/tools/cli-ref-list): Currently displays a list of packages from a given source
  * This will be replaced by an equivalent command **`nuget search`** which will be later enhanced with more capabilities as we make progress with or [search improvements](nvmd got it: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/6371​​​​​​​).
* [`nuget add`](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/tools/cli-ref-add): Currently adds a specified package to a non-HTTP package source (a folder or UNC path) in a hierarchical layout, wherein folders are created for the package ID and version number. 
  * This will be replaced by overloading **`nuget push`** command.

> These commands will be deprecated i.e. there will be a warning on usage of these commands in 5.0 so that in future releases these commands can be discontinued.
